meanings.definition: The fee paid for the right to harvest timber on a specific area of land.
meanings.sent1: The stumpage for the forest was reasonable, so the lumber company decided to proceed with the deal.
meanings.sent2: The landowner charged a fair stumpage for the timber cutting rights.
meanings.sent3: The forest animals held a meeting to discuss pooling their acorns to pay the stumpage fee.
meanings.sent4: The stumpage cost was like a toll booth on the road to woodcutting paradise.
meanings.sent5: The stumpage fee was as essential as the key to the treasure chest of trees.

meanings.definition: The standing timber on a specific area of land available for harvest.
meanings.sent1: The dense stumpage in the forest made it a prime location for logging.
meanings.sent2: The lumberjacks carefully assessed the quality of the stumpage before beginning the harvest.
meanings.sent3: The trees in the stumpage area whispered secrets to each other about the upcoming logging season.
meanings.sent4: The stumpage stood tall like guardians protecting the woodland realm.
meanings.sent5: The stumpage stretched out like a green carpet waiting to be rolled up for the timber market.
